Introduction

Join the excursion to head home with your very own ZRay Elephant bobble head.

What do I need?

  • Microsoft Azure Trial Subscription
  • About 5 minutes in the hallway track

Let’s do this!

Create a WordPress web app in Azure App Service

  1. Log in to the Azure Preview Portal.

  2. Open the Azure Marketplace either by clicking the Marketplace icon, or by clicking the New icon on the bottom left of the dashboard, selecting Web + Mobile and then Azure Marketplace at the bottom.

  3. Select Web Apps. Search for WordPress and click the WordPress icon.

  4. After reading the description of the WordPress app, select Create.

  5. Click on WEB APP, and provide the required values for configuring your web app.

    • URL: Unique Url for your WordPress site.

    • App Service Plan: LoopConf

    • Pricing Tier:

      • Click Pricing Tier

      • Click View All

      • Select Free

    • Web App Settings: No Changes

    • Location: No Changes

  6. Click on DATABASE, and provide the required values for configuring your MySQL database.

Accept the Legal Terms

  1. If necessary, click SUBSCRIPTION, and specify the subscription to use.

  2. When you have finished defining the web app, click Create, and wait while the new web app is created.

    When the app has been created, you will see the resource group containing web app and database.

Launch and manage your WordPress web app

  1. Click on your new web app to see details about your app.

  2. On the Essentials page, click either Browse or the link under Url to open the web app’s welcome page.

  3. If you have not installed WordPress, enter the appropriate configuration information required by WordPress and click Install WordPress to finalize configuration and open the web app’s login page.

  4. Click Login and enter your credentials.

  5. You’ll have a new WordPress web app that looks similar to the web app below.

Enable the ZRay Add-on

In the Web App Created in the Previous steps:

  1. Click Settings

  2. Click Zend Z-Ray

  3. Click Enable Zend Z-Ray

  4. Select the Free Tier

  5. Accept the license

  6. Track the install progress on the Notification Hub.

  7. The notification returns successful

  8. The Add-on is enabled, click on the management link to administer the extension

  9. Browse to the WordPress site from the previous step to verify the Z-Ray bar is injected at the bottom of the page
